intro: Tournefortia stenoraca, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to parts of tropical Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, narrow leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in warm climates.
